rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;d3236bd6.1502">   <title>Re: Placement providers requesting to see the certificate </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;d3236bd6.1502</link>   <description> Hi Bob<br><br>Although the DBS certificate maybe clear, placement providers may have concerns about individual(s). I recently attended a Duty to Refer session with the DBS which was very informative. Although an individuals certificate maybe clear placement providers/employers may have concerns about an individual working with Vulnerable adults and or children which have never been previously raised or the individual may not have been charged for... [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T12:54:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jayneeka Lad</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;d3236bd6.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;70e21d97.1502">   <title>Re: Placement providers requesting to see the certificate </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;70e21d97.1502</link>   <description> Hi Jayneeka<br><br>That is interesting. Our policy position is that the placement providers should not ask to see the certificates and trust the University to have made an appropriate judgment on the student's suitability.<br><br>Bob<br><br>Bob Savill<br>Head of Admissions<br>University of Chichester<br>(T) 01243 812105<br><br>Winner of the Sunday Times and Times 'Best University for Student Retention award' - The Good University Guide 2014 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T12:07:25+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bob Savill</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;70e21d97.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;f778dc93.1502">   <title>Re: Placement providers requesting to see the certificate </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;f778dc93.1502</link>   <description> Hi Bob<br><br>We have been receiving the same amount of requests as per previous years, we do advise our applicants/students to take their original certificates to the placement providers on their first day of placement. Is this request for those who have registered to the update service or a mixture?<br><br>Kind Regards<br>Jayneeka [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T09:36:31+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jayneeka Lad</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;f778dc93.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;a9b63bf8.1502">   <title>Placement providers requesting to see the certificate </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;a9b63bf8.1502</link>   <description> Hello<br><br>I have had a few instances recently of placement providers for Social Work insisting that they see the student's DBS certificate. Interestingly, they were not local authorities but rather were private providers (who were also subject to OFSTED inspections). Is that something others are finding more common recently?<br><br>Bob Savill<br>Head of Admissions<br>University of Chichester<br>(T) 01243 812105 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T09:03:28+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bob Savill</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;a9b63bf8.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;b94e2278.1501">   <title>eBulk suppliers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;b94e2278.1501</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>We are currently looking into potential suppliers of 'eBulk' DBS systems as our contract with our current supplier (Atlantic Data) expires this year. We have used Atlantic Data for some time and are satisfied with their service, but our Procurement regulations require us to explore options of other suppliers. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-22T15:09:31+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rebecca Hornby</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;b94e2278.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;ca173883.1412">   <title>Re: Medical checking </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;ca173883.1412</link>   <description> Thanks, Narinder.<br><br>Bob<br><br>This e-mail and any attachments are intended for the addressee only and may be confidential. If you are not the intended\ufffd\ufffd recipient, please advise the sender as soon as practicable and\ufffd\ufffddelete the e-mail from your system.\ufffd\ufffd<br>The University of Chichester is a company limited by\ufffd\ufffdguarantee,\ufffd\ufffdregistered in England and Wales. Registration number 4740553. The registered office is College Lane, Chichester, West\ufffd\ufffdSussex,\ufffd\ufffdPO19 6PE.<br>\ufffd\ufffd [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-17T12:59:29+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bob Savill</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;ca173883.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;6058ad31.1412">   <title>Re: Medical checking </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;6058ad31.1412</link>   <description> Hi both<br><br>Thank you for the contact details, I will look into them.<br><br>Bob, in terms of in-house what I mean is that we have a Medical Centre on campus. They are technically separate to the University however we are linked for medical checking and OH issues. Admissions send out paper medical questionnaires and completed forms are reviewed by our Medical Centre, at a cost. Any adjustments are made in conjunction with the Medical Centre, relevant college, the University Disability Unit, along with the student. As you suggest the majority have no further actions or adjustments, but there still is [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-17T12:55:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Narinder Madan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;6058ad31.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;2414c4e2.1412">   <title>Re: Medical checking </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;2414c4e2.1412</link>   <description> Hi Narinder,<br><br>We have used a company called OH Works Ltd for the past couple of years -<br><br>http://www.ohworks.co.uk/our-services/for-colleges-and-universities/<br><br>I don't get involved in the admin' side of Health Screening but as far as I am aware the system works OK.<br><br>Kind Regards,<br><br>Lucy<br><br>Lucy Kannenberg<br>Applicant Checks Officer<br>University of East London<br>Institutional Compliance Team<br>Docklands Campus<br>London<br>E16 2RD<br><br>Email : l.kannenberg@uel.ac.uk<br>Tel : 0208 223 6271   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-17T11:28:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lucy Kannenberg</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;2414c4e2.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;3efa38cb.1412">   <title>Re: Medical checking </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;3efa38cb.1412</link>   <description> Dear Narinder<br><br>Chichester have used Occupational Health Consultancy Limited for quite a few years and they have provided a good service.<br><br>I am interested how an in-house service may be provided. I am struck that for the vast majority of applicants there is no action to be taken but nonetheless there is still a charge for each questionnaire completed / reviewed so the idea of an in-house service is interesting, particularly where a questionnaire indicates no further action. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-17T11:33:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bob Savill</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;3efa38cb.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;c92ab4a.1412">   <title>Medical checking </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;c92ab4a.1412</link>   <description> Hello all<br><br>I deal with the University's DBS checking and Medical checking, which is currently completed in house. Can I ask if anyone outsources their medical checking and if so which company do you use/recommend?<br><br>Kind regards<br>Narinder<br><br>Narinder Madan (Mrs)<br>Senior Admissions Officer/DBS Co-ordinator<br><br>Brunel University London<br>Admissions Office<br>Registry<br><br>Room 213, Bannerman Centre<br>Brunel University London, Uxbridge, UB8 3PH, United Kingdom<br>T +44 (0) 1895 267296<br>www.brunel.ac.uk/courses/admissions   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-17T10:11:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Narinder Madan</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;c92ab4a.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;44ede22b.1406">   <title>Re: Update service </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;44ede22b.1406</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;44ede22b.1406">Re: Update service </a></description>   <dc:date>2014-06-23T09:17:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Karen Marsden</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;44ede22b.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;8c114f8b.1406">   <title>Re: Update service </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;8c114f8b.1406</link>   <description> Hi<br><br>At our institution we are asking the applicants/students to complete a consent form if they register to the update service, to confirm whether or not they give us their consent to view there information.<br><br>This information is stored in their paper file, but we will be keeping an electronic record of their Issue Number and Date on our database as a referral point. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-23T08:53:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jayneeka Lad</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;8c114f8b.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;269c0515.1406">   <title>Update service </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;269c0515.1406</link>   <description> Hello all,<br><br>Can I ask what people are doing regarding a) accepting DBS checks on the Update Service and b) logging the information?<br><br>Thanks,<br><br>Tom Cottington<br>Interview and DBS Coordinator<br>University of Roehampton | London | SW15 5PU<br>t.cottington@roehampton.ac.uk&lt;mailto:t.cottington@roehampton.ac.uk&gt; | www.roehampton.ac.uk&lt;http://www.roehampton.ac.uk/&gt;<br>Tel: +44 (0) 20 8392 3850| Fax: +44 (0) 20 8392 3220<br>Follow us on TWITTER&lt;http://www.twitter.com/RoehamptonUni&gt; | Find us on FACEBOOK&lt;http://www.facebook.com/roehampton.uni&gt;<br>Join our circle on Google+&lt;https://plus.google.com/b/110466050670991984102/110466050670991984102/about&gt; | Connect via LinkedIn&lt;http://www.linkedin.com/company/university-of-roehampton?trk=cp_followed_name_university-of-roehampton&gt; [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-06-19T11:34:05+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tom Cottingham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;269c0515.1406</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;6c83ccfb.1405">   <title>Re: Legal Definition of 'work with children' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;6c83ccfb.1405</link>   <description> Hi<br><br>All the article is looking to do is draw people's attention to the fact that there is one list for 'work with children', similar to the one list for 'work with adults', it does not extend the definition of regulated activity. Of course, RA is just one of the prescribed positions that are eligible for a DBS check, others would include licensing. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-29T14:51:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rob Dawson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;6c83ccfb.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;9247a1cf.1405">   <title>Re: Legal Definition of 'work with children' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;9247a1cf.1405</link>   <description> Hi<br><br>The way I read it, eligibility for a barred list check would not be affected by the changes. Therefore, the Statutory guidance: Regulated Activity (children) - supervision of activity with children which is regulated activity when unsupervised&lt;https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/253564/Supervision_guidance.pdf&gt; would also be unaffected. Consequently, if someone is 'supervised' then you cannot do a child barred list check. I think it clarifies that organisations can request an Enhanced Check, without the barred list, if they have performed a risk assessment and deem it necessary (because someone is doing 'supervised' regulated activity). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-29T13:56:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tomson, Laura</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;9247a1cf.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;421b77b6.1405">   <title>Legal Definition of 'work with children' </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;421b77b6.1405</link>   <description> Hi everyone,<br><br>Is anyone else as confused as I am by the section on the legal definition of 'work with children' in the latest DBS news (attached)?<br><br>I've looked at this several times and the related documents and legislation and my reading of it seems to be that eligibility for enhanced checks is significantly changing in at least two ways: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-29T10:50:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Carey-Jones, Gareth</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;421b77b6.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;e8d1702.1405">   <title>Update Service - policies and implementation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;e8d1702.1405</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>We are currently considering our policy around use of the Update Service across the University, and wonder if others would share their positions / experiences on this, in particular -<br><br>(a) Are you accepting existing DBS certificates + the Update Service when presented with them by applicants? Is anyone asking for new disclosures rather than using the Update Service in certain circumstances? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-05-13T14:46:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Shaw, Jillian</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;e8d1702.1405</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;b1a78ef4.1404">   <title>Re: International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;b1a78ef4.1404</link>   <description> Although the majority of our checks are carried out face to face, we have in the past carried out a DBS check when it was not possible for the applicant to attend in person, but also have a robust process in place and again following advice from the DBS as long as the Registered body fully complies with the DBS identification checking process and is confident that the applicants true identity is established, then photographic evidence is not mandatory to process the application. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-28T07:59:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Catherine Thornton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;b1a78ef4.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;d6a5887a.1404">   <title>Re: International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;d6a5887a.1404</link>   <description> We carry out in excess of 2000 applicant DBS checks per year and the majority are not face to face checks, as this is simply not feasible. However we have robust processes in place and as a Registered Body fully comply with the DBS identification checking process, and are confident that we are establishing/validating an applicant's true identity. Although the DBS advise that documents with photographic identity should be sought in the first instance, and compared against an applicant's likeness, our understanding is that this is not mandatory and previous advice from the CRB/DBS has confirmed this. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T15:37:41+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Melissa Thomas</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;d6a5887a.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;d69fcd7e.1404">   <title>Re: International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;d69fcd7e.1404</link>   <description> Dear Sheila<br><br>There is a useful section in the April DBS Disclosure news about using a 'care of' address for overseas applicants, so I believe that it is possible to perform a check if they aren't a UK resident.<br><br>Regards, Laura<br><br>Laura Tomson<br>HR Policy Officer<br>HR Policy and Planning Team<br>Tel: 020 3108 3995 Internal Ext: 53995<br>Fax: 020 7916 8507<br>www.ucl.ac.uk/hr<br>\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T14:23:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tomson, Laura</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;d69fcd7e.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;4aab50da.1404">   <title>Re: International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;4aab50da.1404</link>   <description> My understanding is a check cannot be done until the person has been resident in the UK so we would not not undertake a check before arrival when that was not the case but would be seeking whatever statements of character were available from the authorities in the country of residence. Judgements then have to be made as to whether these are reliable and taken in the context of other evidence such as references. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T14:04:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sheila C Dowling</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;4aab50da.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;3148e187.1404">   <title>Re: International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;3148e187.1404</link>   <description> Hi Catherine,<br><br>How can you do a DBS check without the student and documents in front of you?<br><br>Regards,<br><br>Tom Cottington<br>Interview and DBS coordinator<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: DBS-HE [mailto:CRB-HE@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Catherine Thornton<br>Sent: 25 April 2014 12:37<br>To: CRB-HE@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: [CRB-HE] International students requiring a DBS check<br><br>Hi Tom,<br><br>Thank you for your response, my concern is students do not tend to open a bank account until they arrive in the UK and as the placement visits start so early in the course, it is unlikely the DBS check will be back in time if we [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T14:18:28+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tom Cottingham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;3148e187.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;1153c15b.1404">   <title>Re: International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;1153c15b.1404</link>   <description> Slightly off topic but still relevant - I wonder if anyone has (re)examined how rigorous their processes are on overseas DBS equivalents, in light of the Southbank International School horror story&lt;http://www.theguardian.com/society/2014/apr/24/paedophile-images-southbank-school-pupils-computer&gt;.<br><br>Does anyone have any best practice ideas on ensuring a robust process for making sure an overseas DBS is done and flagged up when one needs doing? The system relies on the applicants honesty and accuracy and while I\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdd hate to see a system where we need to be getting proof of residency for the 5 years from applicants, I could see it coming down the line\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T11:55:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tom Smith</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;1153c15b.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;82a3619e.1404">   <title>Re: International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;82a3619e.1404</link>   <description> Thanks Nicola   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T12:39:09+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Catherine Thornton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;82a3619e.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;dfebe164.1404">   <title>Re: International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;dfebe164.1404</link>   <description> Hi Tom,<br><br>Thank you for your response, my concern is students do not tend to open a bank account until they arrive in the UK and as the placement visits start so early in the course, it is unlikely the DBS check will be back in time if we wait until they arrive. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T12:36:34+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Catherine Thornton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;dfebe164.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;3e1416d1.1404">   <title>Re: International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;3e1416d1.1404</link>   <description> Hello Catherine,<br><br>An overseas student often opens a UK bank account so the opening letter can be used...<br><br>Regards,<br><br>Tom Cottington<br>Interview and DBS coordinator<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: DBS-HE [mailto:CRB-HE@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Crbs<br>Sent: 25 April 2014 12:07<br>To: CRB-HE@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: [CRB-HE] International students requiring a DBS check<br><br>Dear Catherine,<br><br>If the student requies a visa to come to the UK, that can be used as one of the documents (in addition to the passport) as long as it is valid. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T12:12:46+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Tom Cottingham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;3e1416d1.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;a7971cbc.1404">   <title>Re: International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;a7971cbc.1404</link>   <description> Dear Catherine,<br><br>If the student requies a visa to come to the UK, that can be used as one of the documents (in addition to the passport) as long as it is valid.<br><br>Hope that helps<br><br>Kind regards<br><br>Nicola    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T11:06:30+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Crbs</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;a7971cbc.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;839415ad.1404">   <title>International students requiring a DBS check </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;839415ad.1404</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>We have an international student due to start one of our teaching courses in September who currently lives outside the EEA and we need to complete a DBS application before they arrive in the UK, as the placement visits start early in the term.<br><br>The documents listed which we can use to enable us to complete the enhanced identification checking process is extremely limited, with the exception of a passport and the possibility that the applicant has a valid driving licence, the only other document that it appears we can accept is \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdLetter of sponsorship from future employment [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-25T11:27:37+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Catherine Thornton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;839415ad.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;ab6312e7.1404">   <title>PLEASE IGNORE TEST MAIL </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;ab6312e7.1404</link>   <description> Thank you and kind regards.    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-10T16:02:24+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Rob Dawson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;ab6312e7.1404</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;53729d5f.1404">   <title>On line processing of DBS applications </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;53729d5f.1404</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>I know there have been discussions previously about this, but I am currently looking into using a 'hosted' online criminal record checking service for the processing of our disclosure applications for both staff and students, and would be interested to hear from others already using this. In particular, do you [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-04-07T10:18:20+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Liz Felgate</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CRB-HE;53729d5f.1404</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
